page.title: 15EAST COKER RESERVOIR
page.content: Sutton Bingham Water Works and {Reservoir}were built in 1954-1956. The{catchment area is 3023 ha.and the {annual rainfall is 965mm.}The storage capacity is 2387Ml.and the greatest depth is 12.2m.Tha{dam}has a maximum height of 13.4m.and is made of materials excavated from the site. There are 3 pumps,11 sedimentation tanks and 4 rapid gravity filters. Although only manned for short periods throughout the woking day it is{continuously monitored}24 hours per day from a control room at{Bristol. The reservoir provides facilities for {dinghy usage,sailing and fishing.}It is stocked with brown and rainbow trout. {Wildfowl}and wading birds visit the reservoir and it is regarded as of National importance for large numbers of wintering wildfowl.
